Speech-to-Text Output: Doctor, can you please tell me what is the problem and how can I solve this and what type of tumour it is?
Doctor's Diagnosis:
There are multiple tumorous masses in the brain, most of them being close to the ventricle. Most of these are on the left side of the brain. Tentatively, this appears to be Meningioma. This might affect different aspects of brain functionality, including vision and motor functions. People frequently experience a sudden, severe headache with nausea and vomiting when this develops as an emergency. Symptoms of some patients start with a slow onset, showing brain functionality such as loss of feeling in the face, arm, or leg or neurological issues such as confusion or personality changes. 

It can be cured by both surgery and radiation. The appropriate action has to be decided after medical testing.
